title: Creamy Marry Me Soup for Cozy Dinners

description: Indulge in the rich flavors of Creamy Marry Me Soup, perfect for cozy dinners or special occasions. This delightful blend will impress your guests and warm your heart.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic, sauté until softened.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Stir in heavy cream and frozen peas, simmer for 10 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.
tips: For a richer flavor, use homemade chicken broth. Ensure the soup simmers gently to avoid curdling the cream. Adjust seasoning to your preference for the best taste.

structured_content.content: Picture this: a velvety soup with a harmonious blend of flavors, perfect for warming up on a chilly evening. The aroma of sautéed garlic and onion fills the air, inviting everyone to the table. This dish is not only comforting but also impressively simple to prepare, making it a go-to for busy nights.

structured_content.content: I stumbled upon this recipe while searching for a comforting soup to warm my family on a cold night. The first time I made it, my partner couldn't stop raving about it, and now it's a staple in our home.

• Primary component: Chicken broth - forms the flavorful base of the soup
  • Essential aromatics/flavor elements: Onion and garlic - provide depth and aroma
  • Complementary components: Heavy cream and peas - add creaminess and sweetness
  • Required tools: Large pot, cutting board, knife, stirring spoon

upload.context: Fresh chopped onions and minced garlic arranged on a cutting board, ready for cooking.

structured_content.content:
Initial Setup:
Chop the onion and mince the garlic.
Main Cooking Phase:
Heat olive oil in a large pot, sauté onion and garlic, then add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Stir in cream and peas, simmer for 10 minutes.
Final Assembly:
Season with salt and pepper, serve hot garnished with parsley.

upload.context: Creamy Marry Me Soup simmering in a large pot with steam rising and vibrant green peas visible.

note.label: Essential Knowledge
note.content:
• Use fresh ingredients for the best flavor
  • Avoid boiling the cream to prevent curdling
  • Soup is done when peas are tender and heated through
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days

structured_content.content: Every time I serve this soup, my family gathers around the table, savoring each spoonful. It's a reminder that simple ingredients can create unforgettable meals that bring us together.
Add a squeeze of lemon juice for brightness, or a pinch of red pepper flakes for heat. A sprinkle of grated Parmesan on top enhances the creamy flavor.
Serve with crusty bread for dipping or alongside a fresh garden salad for a complete meal.
Substitute vegetable broth for a vegetarian version, or replace heavy cream with coconut milk for a dairy-free option.

upload.context: Creamy Marry Me Soup plated in a rustic bowl with fresh parsley garnish and crusty bread on the side.

note.label: Expert Insights
note.content:
• For a deeper flavor, roast the garlic before adding it to the soup
  • Blend the soup for a smooth texture if desired
  • Timing is crucial; add peas last to maintain their bright color
  • Serve in warmed bowls for an inviting presentation

structured_content.content: Don't let busy schedules rob you of delicious meals. This creamy Marry Me Soup is ready in just 45 minutes, proving that comfort food can be both simple and satisfying. Your family will love this delightful dish!
